specs:capability.name: Web Resilience
specs:capability.description: Capability of surviving to security incidents involving a web server, by implementing proper strategies aimed at preserving business continuity, achieved through redundancy and/or diversity.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: CONTINGENCY PLAN - CP-2
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization develops a contingency plan for the information system for achieving continuity of operations for mission/business functions. Contingency planning addresses both information system restoration and implementation of alternative mission/business processes when systems are compromised.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: HETEROGENEITY - SC-29
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization employs a diverse set of information technologies for information system components in the implementation of the information system. In particular, the organization employs virtualization techniques to support the deployment of a diversity of applications.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: DISTRIBUTED PROCESSING AND STORAGE - SC-36
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization distributes processing and storage across multiple physical locations.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: DENIAL OF SERVICE PROTECTION - SC-5
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The information system protects against or limits the effects of denial of service attacks by employing proper security safeguards.

specs:capability.name: DOS Detection and Mitigation
specs:capability.description: Capability of detecting and reacting to security attacks aimed at distrupting a system's availability.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: DENIAL OF SERVICE PROTECTION - SC-5
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The information system protects against or limits the effects of denial of service attacks by employing proper security safeguards.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: DENIAL OF SERVICE PROTECTION - SC-5(3)
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The information system protects against or limits the effects of denial of service attacks by employing proper security safeguards.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: CONTINUOUS MONITORING - CA-7
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization develops a continuous monitoring strategy and implements a continuous monitoring program, which includes the selection of proper metrics, the definition of a monitoring frequency, the establishment of response actions to address results of the analysis of security-related information and the reporting of the security status with a defined frequency.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: INFORMATION SYSTEM MONITORING - SI-4
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization monitors the information system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks in accordance with a defined monitoring objectives and unauthorized local, network, and remote connections. It identifies unauthorized use of the information system and deploys proper monitoring tools to collect information about the system.

specs:capability.name: Software Vulnerability Assessment
specs:capability.description: Capability of detecting and mitigating vulnerabilities

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: CONTINUOUS MONITORING - CA-7
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization develops a continuous monitoring strategy and implements a continuous monitoring program, which includes the selection of proper metrics, the definition of a monitoring frequency, the establishment of response actions to address results of the analysis of security-related information and the reporting of the security status with a defined frequency.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: CONTINUOUS MONITORING | TREND ANALYSES - CA-7(3)
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization employs trend analysis to determine if security control implementations, the frequency of continuous monitoring activities, and/or the types of activities used in the continuous monitoring process need to be modified based on empirical data.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: PENETRATION TESTING - CA-8
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization conducts penetration testing with a defined frequency on the system.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: VULNERABILITY SCANNING - RA-5
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization scans for vulnerabilities in the information system and hosted applications with a defined frequency and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system/applications are identified and reported by adopting vulnerability scanning tools that are able to enumerate platforms, software flaws and improper configurations. The organization analyzes vulnerability scan reports and results and is able to perform a remediation in a given time period.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: VULNERABILITY SCANNING | UPDATE BY FREQUENCY - RA-5(1)
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization updates the information system vulnerabilities scanned with a defined frequency

specs:capability.name: Transport Layer Security
specs:capability.description: Capability of ensuring data integrity and mutual authentication between two or more communicating actors

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: TRANSMISSION CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTEGRITY - SC-8
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The information system protects the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of transmitted information.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: CRYPTOGRAPHIC KEY ESTABLISHMENT AND MANAGEMENT - SC-12
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization establishes and manages cryptographic keys for required cryptography employed within the information system in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction].

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: CRYPTOGRAPHIC PROTECTION - SC-13
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The information system implements [Assignment: organization-defined cryptographic uses and type of cryptography required for each use] in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: PUBLIC KEY INFRASTRUCTURE CERTIFICATES - SC-17
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization issues public key certificates under an [Assignment: organization-defined certificate policy] or obtains public key certificates from an approved service provider.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: HETEROGENEITY - SC-29
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization employs a diverse set of information technologies for information system components in the implementation of the information system. In particular, the organization employs virtualization techniques to support the deployment of a diversity of applications.

specs:NISTsecurityControl.name: USAGE RESTRICTIONS - SC-43
specs:NISTsecurityControl.nist:description: The organization: a.Establishes usage restrictions and implementation guidance for [Assignment: organization-defined information system components] based on the potential to cause damage to the information system if used maliciously; and b. Authorizes, monitors, and controls the use of such components within the information system.

specs:MetricDefinition.specs:expression: The number of replicas of the Web Container that are set-up and kept active throughout the service operation to ensure redundancy. It is measured through measurement "number_of_servers_wp_msr1"
specs:MetricDefinition.specs:definition: This abstract metric expresses the number of replicas of a software component that are set-up and kept active during system operation

specs:RuleDefinition.name: Level of Redundancy Check Strategy
specs:RuleDefinition.specs:definition: This rule defines how to check the number of active replicas: the check may be done according to different strategies:{ping,heartbit}

specs:ParameterDefinition.name: Level of Redundancy Observation Interval
specs:ParameterDefinition.specs:definition: This parameter refers to the time, expressed in hours, between two subsequent observations

specs:MetricRule.specs:note: The check of active replicas is done by pinging them at defined time intervals

specs:MetricParameter.specs:note: The check is done every hour

specs:MetricDefinition.specs:definition: Number of responsive web servers running on the system, measured by the load balancer.

specs:RuleDefinition.name: Number of Servers Check Strategy
specs:RuleDefinition.specs:definition: This rule defines how to check the number of responsive web servers

specs:ParameterDefinition.name: Number of Servers Check Interval
specs:ParameterDefinition.specs:definition: This parameter refers to the time, expressed in hours, between two subsequent checks

specs:MetricRule.specs:note: The check of active replicas is done by the Load Balancer by pinging them at defined time intervals

specs:MetricParameter.specs:note: The check is done every hour

specs:MetricDefinition.specs:expression: The number of different software and/or hardware versions of the Web Container service that are set-up and kept active throughout the service operation to increase the protection from attacks and vulnerabilities exploits. It is measured through measurement "diversity_level_wp_msr2"
specs:MetricDefinition.specs:definition: This abstract metric expresses the number of replicas of a software component that are set-up and kept active during system operation

specs:RuleDefinition.name: Level of Diversity Check Strategy
specs:RuleDefinition.specs:definition: This rule defines how to check the number of different active replicas: the check may be done according to different strategies

specs:ParameterDefinition.name: Level of Diversity Check Interval
specs:ParameterDefinition.specs:definition: This parameter refers to the time, expressed in hours, between two subsequent observations

specs:MetricRule.specs:note: The check of different active web servers is done by pinging them at defined time intervals and by checking the response header

specs:MetricParameter.specs:note: The check is done every hour

specs:MetricDefinition.specs:definition: Number of web server types active.

specs:RuleDefinition.name: Number of Server Types Check Strategy
specs:RuleDefinition.specs:definition: This rule defines how to check the number of different servers active: the check may be done according to different strategies

specs:ParameterDefinition.name: Number of Server Types Observation Interval
specs:ParameterDefinition.specs:definition: This parameter refers to the time, expressed in hours, between two subsequent observations

specs:MetricRule.specs:note: The check of different active web servers is done by pinging them at defined time intervals and by checking the response header

specs:MetricParameter.specs:note: The check is done every hour

specs:MetricDefinition.specs:expression: The frequency of vulnerability scanning(e.g., a value of "24h" requires that scanning is done once per day).

specs:ParameterDefinition.name: Scanning Frequency Check Interval

specs:MetricDefinition.specs:expression: The frequency of checks for updates of the vulnerable installed libraries
specs:MetricDefinition.specs:definition: This metric sets the frequency of checks for updates and upgrades of vulnerable installed libraries. At the implementation time, SPECS generates vulnerability list, performs the vulnerability scan of the system, and generates scanning report. Then periodically checks for available updates and upgrades of libraries on which vulnerabilities have been detected. For example, for up_report_frequency=24, SPECS ensures that checks for updates and upgrades are performed at least once every day.

specs:RuleDefinition.name: Up Report Frequency Check Strategy
specs:RuleDefinition.specs:definition: This rule defines how to check that the checks for updates are performed with the desired frequency

specs:ParameterDefinition.name: Up Report Frequency Check Interval

specs:MetricRule.specs:value: check timestamp of last update report
